keyFactors.title: Momentum From Edmonton Blowout
keyFactors.description: Stars destroyed the Oilers 8-3 the night before. Team confidence at all-time high. Offensive rhythm locked in.

keyFactors.title: Offensive Firepower Clicking
keyFactors.description: Nathan Bastian had 2 goals, Wyatt Johnston had a goal and 3 assists vs Edmonton. Entire team contributing.

keyFactors.title: Seattle Home Struggles
keyFactors.description: Kraken have been inconsistent at Climate Pledge Arena. Not getting the home ice advantage expected.

keyFactors.title: Value at -150
keyFactors.description: Fair price was around -145. Slight value on a hot team with momentum edge.

riskFactors: Seattle capable of upset at home

vladislavKolyachonok.note: Defenseman scored first goal of the season with 5:44 left - the game winner

quarterBreakdown.description: Tight checking, minimal scoring chances for both teams. Stars took early 1-0 lead. Physical, low-event period.
Both teams traded goals. Kraken tied it, Dallas regained lead, Seattle answered again. Game remained close and competitive.
VLADISLAV KOLYACHONOK broke the tie with 5:44 remaining. His first goal of the season proved to be the game-winner. Stars held on for narrow 3-2 victory.

gameResults.whenCleared: Game-winning goal came with 5:44 left in third. Stars held on through final 5+ minutes.
gameResults.gamePace: Low-scoring, tight-checking game. Opposite of the 8-3 blowout vs Edmonton but Stars found a way.

whatWentRight.title: Momentum Carried Over
whatWentRight.description: Despite back-to-back, the confidence from the Edmonton blowout translated. Team believed they could win.

whatWentRight.title: Unlikely Hero Emerged
whatWentRight.description: Vladislav Kolyachonok, a defenseman with his first goal of the season, scored the game-winner. Good teams find ways.

whatWentRight.title: Close-Game Execution
whatWentRight.description: After blowing out Edmonton 8-3, Stars showed they could win a grind-it-out 3-2 game too. Two styles, two wins.

whatWentRight.title: Energy Management on Back-to-Back
whatWentRight.description: Despite playing the night before, Dallas maintained enough energy to win a tight road game. Championship-level depth.

statisticalContext.margin: Won by 1 goal - needed every bit
statisticalContext.backToBackNote: Won both games of back-to-back (8-3 vs EDM, 3-2 vs SEA)

postGameAnalysis.wasNormalVariance: Gutsy road win on a back-to-back. Could have gone either way - Kolyachonok's unlikely goal was the difference. But hot teams make their own luck.

closingLineValue.verdict: Slight positive CLV. Line moved toward Stars as market recognized the momentum factor.

keyTakeaways: Teams on hot streaks carry momentum even on back-to-backs
Trust the process when offense is clicking
Good teams find ways to win close games
Unlikely heroes emerge when confidence is high
Kolyachonok's first goal of season was game-winner
Different game style (3-2 grinder vs 8-3 blowout) but same result: W
verdict: Gutsy road win on a back-to-back. Stars showed championship mentality - can win blowouts (8-3) and grinders (3-2). Kolyachonok's unlikely hero moment was the difference. Trust hot teams.
